title: Nvidia earnings, The Private Credit bubble, Gemini 3 & The "ARR" lie
description: This episode dives into Nvidia's blockbuster Q3 earnings and the AI market dynamics fueling its growth. The hosts also dissect the looming risks in Private Credit, why Google's Gemini 3 could dominate the AI race, and the misleading use of ARR metrics by startups.
keyTakeaways: Nvidia delivered record-breaking Q3 revenue of $57 billion, driven by surging AI demand and data center growth.
The Private Credit market faces a 'subprime'-style risk due to insufficient diligence on corporate debt.
Google's Gemini 3 benefits from vertical integration across chips, cloud, and applications, positioning it to win the AI race.
Startups often manipulate ARR (Annualized Recurring Revenue) metrics, obscuring true contract quality and growth.
Sequoia Capital is experiencing leadership turnover and missed investment opportunities amid industry shifts.
VCs are struggling to keep pace with rapid technological changes and mega funds are competing with emerging managers.
highlights: "Private Credit Risks: Lack of diligence is creating a 'subprime' risk in corporate debt."
"Google's Advantage: Vertical integration (Chips + Cloud + Apps) gives Gemini the long-term edge."
"Metric Manipulation: Investors need to look past 'ARR' and check actual contracts."
